programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Earl helps restore an abandoned rottweiler to health. A service dog organisation from North Carolina contacts the centre seeking a new dog for their programme

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 14 August 1998. Featuring Apollo 440, Hinda Hicks, Sash! featuring Tina Cousins, Solid Harmonie, Placebo, Will Smith, Fun Lovin Criminals and Boyzone

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Andy Peebles presents an edition first broadcast on October 11, 1979. Includes performances by the Dooleys, the Headboys, Chic, Dr Hook, Viola Wills, the Charlie Daniels Band, Errol Dunkley, Cats UK, Dave Edmunds, Dana and the Police. Plus, dance sequences by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Steve Wright present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on October 16. Featuring performances by Pet Shop Boys, Cliff Richard and Sarah Brightman, Boris Gardiner, Marti Webb, Paul Hardcastle, Nick Berry and Status Quo

programme.title: Country Queens at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive performances by female country-music stars from a variety of BBC studio shows. Featured acts include Bobbie Gentry, Anne Murray, Emmylou Harris, Taylor Swift, Crystal Gayle, Tammy Wynette, Billie Jo Spears, and Lucinda Williams with Mary Chapin Carpenter

programme.title: Coolidge and Kristofferson: Sounds Like Friday
programme.desc: An evening of song hosted by Kris Kristofferson and Rita Coolidge. With Billy Swan and Barbara Carroll. First broadcast 29 September 1978

programme.title: Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy is joined on stage at the Maltings Concert Hall by guests Richard Harding, Johnny McEvoy, The Tennessee Gentlemen and The Bill Clarke Five. Songs include Staying Home Woman, I Dont Wanna Play House, Ways to Love a Man and Golden Ring. First broadcast 7 September 1977

programme.title: Sisters in Country: Dolly, Linda and Emmylou
programme.desc: How Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harriss careers took off in the 1970s with very distinct takes on country music, before they came together to collaborate on a successful album in 1987. The artists talk about uniting as harmony singers, focusing on how their alliance made them pioneers in bringing different music worlds together and raising the game for women in the country tradition. Narrated by KT Tunstall

programme.title: Country Queens at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive performances by female country-music stars from a variety of BBC studio shows. Featured acts include Bobbie Gentry, Anne Murray, Emmylou Harris, Taylor Swift, Crystal Gayle, Tammy Wynette, Billie Jo Spears, and Lucinda Williams with Mary Chapin Carpenter

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A celebration of the enduring success of the childrens TV classic. Originally created in Paris in the early 1960s by French animator Serge Danot, the plots were a million miles away from the series that English actor Eric Thompson and animator Ivor Wood rescripted, revoiced and reinterpreted for a British audience

programme.title: The Magic Roundabout
programme.desc: Florence and Brian help Dougal search for a four-leaf clover. A 1968 episode of the classic childrens programme, narrated by Eric Thompson

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James is intrigued after meeting a cowhand, and Mr Dawson disturbs Siegfried. Rural drama about a North Yorkshire vet, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Brian Glover

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: The vets are saddened by the death of George VI, especially as it coincides with the passing away of Mr Potts. Meanwhile, Siegfried decides to help Calum and Deirdre patch things up. Veterinary drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Paula is arrested on suspicion of murder, and Jerôme decides he wants a divorce after discovering some long-held secrets, while Tess continues to weave her web in the family home. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Paula locates the places where Tess grew up and begins to realise that she is probably not who she says she is and that she did not target the Martel family by chance. Meanwhile, Camilles unease is growing as Tess takes advantage of Paulas absence to try and consolidate her position in the family. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: With Patricia Routledge, Morgan Freeman and Gary Lineker
programme.desc: An edition of the talk show from 1998, with actress Patricia Routledge, actor Morgan Freeman and sports presenter Gary Lineker joining Michael Parkinson

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara apply their creative talents when they try to make clothes out of nettles and wool, while Jerry has his eye on becoming the next managing director of JJM. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker prepares to make his first public broadcast as prime minister, but finds it is not so easy to speak to camera as he imagined. John Wells guest stars, alongside Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James is intrigued after meeting a cowhand, and Mr Dawson disturbs Siegfried. Rural drama about a North Yorkshire vet, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Brian Glover

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Jennifer Reoch revisit a case from 2024 in which a teenager suffered lifelong injuries after being hit by a speeding car. The driver is yet to be identified. Plus, how Police Scotland smashed a grooming gang

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A seasoned developer renovates house with multiple safety bolts on the front door in Crewe, Cheshire and a father and daughter modernise a property in Doncaster, South Yorkshire. A former estate agent extends and transforms a house in Gravesend, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams search for money-making items at an antiques fair in Llandeilo, Carmarthenshire, with the help of mentors Izzie Balmer and Richard Madley. Presenter Eric Knowles monitors proceedings and also learns about the centuries-old craft of making chainmail

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: CC Lowsley is totally preoccupied with his upcoming amateur production of The Cursed Arrow. When an actor in the company is murdered, Sister Boniface uncovers a historical motive. Drama, starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Welsh Borders, showcasing some tempting houses to a retired couple who have a whopping £1 million to spend. Along with a characterful property, theyre after somewhere with holiday-let potential or space for a glamping business. Jules is also in his element when he meets experts in traditional construction methods who are keeping heritage building skills alive

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Brenton West, Will Kirk and Suzie Fletcher restore a suit of armour from the 1973 film The Three Musketeers and Walid and Joujou Saad tackle the restoration of a pre-war typewriter brought in by Nicola and her father Joe. Visitor Charlotte brings in a pane of stained glass made by her grandfather and dance teacher Helen is hoping the experts can repair her cowboy boots

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and JB Gill round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: North Coast Riders
programme.desc: Daily life with the people of Northern Irelands rugged north coast, a place where the ocean meets towering cliffs. High summer finds tourists flooding the beaches, while locals teach, guide, climb and surf. All concerned keep the heartbeat of the coast alive. Then, as summer fades and winter swells, the coast empties. However, the adventure deepens as the locals rise to meet the change of season

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Rafi has been left with brain damage after suddenly falling seriously ill. After spending a year in hospital, he has finally returned home only for it to become apparent the house is not equipped to meet his complex needs. At risk of returning to a medical setting, Rafis loved ones are desperate to keep him by their side, where his recovery has already shown remarkable progress. They turn to Nick Knowles and the team for urgent help to transform their home into a safe haven that will give Rafi the chance to thrive and keep the family together

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: Thirtysomething Leonards mother dies suddenly and he faces the world with fresh eyes, aware that if hes not careful, hes going to end up living a small life of complete insignificance. His long-term friend and fellow board game-lover Hungry Pauls own universe is exactly the size he wants it to be, but his mother insists he attend the local hospital alongside her as a volunteer visitor. Then, Leonard encounters office fire warden Shelley - who makes him smile for the first time in weeks. Alex Lawther, Laurie Kynaston and Jamie-Lee ODonnell star in this comedy adapted from Ronán Hessions novel and narrated by Julia Roberts

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: Leonard summons up the courage to talk to Shelley, but a moment of confusion sees him end up on a calamitous date with another woman. However, things subsequently work out for the best and it seems his universe is expanding after all. Across town, Hungry Paul decides to enter an exciting competition. Comedy, narrated by Julia Roberts and starring Alex Lawther, Laurie Kynaston and Jamie-Lee ODonnell

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts, with guest panellists comedian Ross Noble and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Rock legend Bruce Springsteen and The Bear star Jeremy Allen White, who plays Bruce in Springsteen: Deliver Me from Nowhere join the host to discuss the biographical movie. Oscar-winner Jennifer Lawrence discusses her role in psychological drama Die My Love and Tessa Thompson reflects on taking the lead in Hedda, a bold re-imagining of Ibsens Hedda Gabler. Plus, Florence + the Machine perform the new single Everybody Scream

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Hosting Saudi Radio alone in a Norwich business park, Alan posits a question - is solitude healthy or do people need others? If not, can dogs or technology fill the void? Steve Coogan stars

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Actress Jane Horrocks joins the judging panel as Mama Ru tests the queens overacting skills with a series of scripts that pay homage to the UKs famous legacy of bonk-buster fiction. In uncanny timing, Jane, famed for playing the part of hapless PA Bubble in Absolutely Fabulous, is on hand to give her thoughts on a very special Ab Fab runway in A Night of a Thousand Sweetie Darlings. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr complete the judging panel as the queens once again fight for a much-coveted RuPeter badge and survival

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by comedian Chris McCausland and chefs Adejoke Bakare and Theo Randall, while Olly Smith pairs the wines with the studio dishes and Leyli Homayoonfar will be serving up some birria tacos

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trelawny

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Liverpool v Manchester United. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Nottingham Forest v Chelsea

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton visits the spectacular Perth and Kinross countryside, on a mission to help a young couple from Edinburgh realise their dream of a new lifestyle in a rural home

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.sub-title: Countryfile Ramble for BBC Children in Need 2025
programme.desc: Matt Baker, Anita Rani, Sean Fletcher, Joe Crowley and John Craven lace up their walking boots and explore the border of Shropshire and Staffordshire, hearing the stories of young people whose lives have been positively impacted by Children in Need along the way

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Montell Douglas, Owain Wyn Evans, Sarah Greene, Danielle Harold, Colin Jackson and Matt Morsia take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win big. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: After the excitement of movie week, the remaining couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of avoiding the fate of last weeks eliminated couple Ross King and Jowita Przystal. Several couples have impressed in the opening weeks, but know they are only one poor dance away from slipping down the leaderboard. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Eight celebrities who were voted off first in previous episodes are given a chance to redeem themselves and win £50,000 for charity. Susie McCabe, Joel Corry, Tim Vine, Konan, Donna Preston, Helen Flanagan, Linda Robson and Danny John-Jules take part. Romesh Ranganathan hosts

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: The deadly secret hidden in Flight CBZ517 is discovered, but it still doesnt explain the murders or help the survivors escape. The passengers believe they have found the traitor in the group, but are they right?

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Bournemouth at Selhurst Park, and Sunderland v Wolverhampton Wanderers at The Stadium of Light. Both of last seasons matches between the Eagles and Cherries finished in 0-0 draws, but with both teams getting off to a flying start in this campaign a more exciting match was anticipated. The Black Cats and Wolves were meeting in the top flight for the first time since the 2011/12 season, and the hosts were aiming to continue their excellent early-season form against their struggling visitors. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Chelsea, Brighton and Hove Albion v Newcastle United, Burnley v Leeds United, Manchester City v Everton, and Fulham v Arsenal

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers sits down for a conversation with Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers

programme.desc: Quiet closes in on her search for revenge. John finds himself incapacitated. Sweet Tooth wreaks havoc during his road tour

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: One-off comedy about teenage twins from a middle class British Nigerian family who are determined to make their mark on the world. But that proves easier said then done when living with their parents - and even worse, in Milton Keynes. Starring Moses Alexander and Francesca Amewudah-Rivers

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a cereal killer is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell, but Gromit is more concerned that his master might be the killers next victim

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
programme.desc: Inventor Wallace and his canine sidekick Gromit have set up a pest-control service, and are called in to stop rabbits overrunning a garden show. However, the pair are overwhelmed when a destructive giant bunny arrives on the scene, while an interfering aristocrat contrives to make matters worse. Nick Parks Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Peter Sallis, Ralph Fiennes and Helena Bonham Carter

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie is still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie? Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie throws herself headlong at life, but Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings. Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood, Suranne Jones, Adam Long and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Escape Room
programme.desc: The prospect of winning a significant sum of money lures a group of individuals into a life-threatening scenario. Being locked in several rooms with extreme conditions, they discover the secrets behind the escape room and must fight to survive by finding a way out. Psychological thriller, starring Deborah Ann Woll, Taylor Russell and Tyler Labine

programme.title: Escape Room: Tournament of Champions
programme.desc: The survivors of a deadly game designed by a sinister corporation are dragged back into an even deadlier trap. And as a handful of former escapees join in, the competitors must work together to outsmart their inhuman tormentors and give their all to solve increasingly sophisticated puzzles. Horror sequel, starring Taylor Russell and Logan Miller

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Actress Jane Horrocks joins the judging panel as Mama Ru tests the queens overacting skills with a series of scripts that pay homage to the UKs famous legacy of bonk-buster fiction. In uncanny timing, Jane, famed for playing the part of hapless PA Bubble in Absolutely Fabulous, is on hand to give her thoughts on a very special Ab Fab runway in A Night of a Thousand Sweetie Darlings. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr complete the judging panel as the queens once again fight for a much-coveted RuPeter badge and survival

programme.title: My Mates a Bad Date
programme.desc: Oloni has her work cut out with Vicky as she helps her find her perfect match, hoping to change her behaviour and her unrealistic criteria for her suitors

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Larger than life and fun loving TikTok star Akafi battles with his insecure inner voice, which is hellbent on destroying his self-confidence as he gets ready for a date

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Five years in the future, Amy has put her adventures with the Doctor behind her and is about to become a mother. The Time Lord returns and leaves her facing a heart-breaking choice that will change her life for ever. Toby Jones guest stars alongside Karen Gillan and Matt Smith, in an episode written by Men Behaving Badly creator Simon Nye

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. An ambitious project to drill into the Earth disturbs something underground. As Amy learns she cannot trust even the ground under her feet, it becomes clear that while humans were digging down, another species was on its way up, and an old foe of the Doctors is poised to reclaim a world they believe is theirs by right. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryns decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning. / Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot. / Sushi-Mushi tests new compost fritters recipes. When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Hannahs family is from South Korea, and she will be making a Korean salmon marinade, which is a popular recipe used there. She starts by adding garlic puree, Korean chilli paste, soy sauce, honey, toasted sesame oil and her special ingredient, sesame seeds, into a jug and mixing them all up. Next, Hannah puts pieces of her salmon onto individual baking sheets and spoons the marinade on. She garnishes them with freshly chopped spring onions, and then her salmon is ready to be cooked in the oven. Hannah wears a colourful Korean outfit and treats her friends to some local Korean kimchi, but will her pals be able to guess her special ingredient?

programme.title: Andys Aquatic Adventures

programme.title: Ranger Hamzas Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how sand dunes play an important role in the environment. They find out how sand dunes are made and that they can be great places for lots of plants to grow and creatures to live. They also learn that they can change over time and help prevent erosion from the wind and sea. On the way they spot a beautiful moth and play a game all about the food chain.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild

He shows them his amazing teeth and flippers and then jumps in the water to demonstrate his incredible swimming skills. Next, they visit the biggest rodent in the world, the capybara. Steve and Aneeshwar give them their breakfast and reveal the wild connection between these two very different animals

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.desc: Debra complains she and Ray do not have any fun together - and persuades him to let her join him in his game of golf. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur Marcus Samuelsson goes undercover to find and mentor Americas next great chef. An Ethiopian refugee adopted by a Swedish family, Marcus developed a deep love for cooking at an early age and has since become a renowned force in international cuisine, with over 30 restaurants worldwide. Marcus disguises himself to work incognito in a teaching kitchen, a food truck business, a culinary institute and a soup kitchen, as he searches for undiscovered chefs to mentor

Can Lauren let bygones be bygones, or will the night descend into acrimony and ruin Bernadettes chances of winning the grand prize?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its been a fiery week, and every last one of the BandBers is unhappy with their feedback - especially considering barely anyone has said they would like to return to one anothers establishments. Fireworks seem in prospect as they meet up one last time to go over their scores and find out whos won

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A couple attempt to combine an army lorry and an old caravan to create the ultimate off-roader, and a man returns to his familys farm to build a luxury cabin. Meanwhile, George visits a building in Denmark that was designed to be a work of art and an office, checks out a skip thats been turned into a home, and takes inspiration for his scissor lift cabin from a stunning 18th-century bridge

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didnt even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in Londons popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Amy and Brian from Newtownards, Northern Ireland decide whether to move or renovate their five-bedroom chalet bungalow. After 50 years in the same house, Brian has had enough and wants a more spacious home in the countryside with more storage for his hobbies. Kirstie comes up with a plan to make their existing home feel brand new while Phil heads out to find a future-proof property with accessible ground floor accommodation to suit Brians health needs

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Gloucestershire to visit Jon and Noreen who, in 2013, planned to build a three-bed treehouse on a half-acre patch of woodland. Their stacked three box design was to be almost gravity-defying to avoid harming any tree roots and a mirror glass ground floor to reflect the surrounding trees but their £250,000 budget didnt seem to match the projects high ambition. Despite having worked hands-on for long hours with help from friends and family, by 2016 the house was barely ready enough for them to move in and the money had run out with the project not finished. Seven years later, Kevin returns to see their progress

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes uncovers Uzbekistans rich historical treasures. Near Termez, she traces Alexander the Great and examines how his story became a network of religious exchange. In the countrys north west, she explores the ancient kingdom of Chorasmia, and discovers Zoroastrian funerary practices, sun-worship and exciting new finds. She traces the Sogdians, merchants at the heart of the silk road. New finds in Bukhara reveal the worlds first pack camel statuette, and murals in Afrasiab show rising Sogdian ambitions. In Samarkand, Bettany unravels the story of the women behind Emperor Timur

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: The Ffestiniog Railway carves a path through the towering peaks of Eryri, one of Britains most enchanting mountain ranges and changed the course of Welsh history. Travelling from the harbour town of Porthmadog to the historic slate mines at Blaenau Ffestiniog, Hugh Bonneville explores how the railways transformed a quiet corner of rural Wales into a global industrial powerhouse

programme.title: The Menu

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, a clash between the American fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy, which marked a pivotal turning point in the Pacific Theatre during the Second World War. When US intelligence intercepts messages detailing a Japanese attack on an unnamed location, it becomes a race against time to both figure out where will be hit next and how to prepare for an impending battle. Roland Emmerichs drama, starring Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Woody Harrelson and Luke Evans

programme.title: Fawlty Towers: A Very British Comedy
programme.desc: Created by John Cleese and Connie Booth, Fawlty Towers reached heights of popularity few shows at the time could rival. So, why does it only exist in a recut, sanitised and edited form, with some of the original scenes deleted? This programme looks at controversies surrounding the classic comedy, examining its sometimes uncomfortable place in the modern world, using deleted scenes and archival interviews to piece together the story of how a sitcom that seemed untouchable in the 1970s came to be viewed through a more critical lens

programme.desc: Ben Fogle heads back to the jewel of the Indian Ocean to catch up with British vet Janey, who set up a rescue centre for Sri Lankas street-dogs. programme.desc: Ben travels to Eastern Europe to meet Brits Jordan, Lewis and their two children, who are undertaking a renovation of a dilapidated farmhouse in a Bulgarian village. programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley: Funniest Moments
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating Richard Curtiss much-loved sitcom, featuring clips along with insight and analysis from cast, crew and celebrity fans. The programme examines how the fictional village of Dibley was never the same once Dawn Frenchs inimitable comedy creation Geraldine Granger arrived as the new vicar, and there is a look at the Comic Relief specials

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Beast from the East: The Big Freeze of 2018
programme.desc: Britain was chilled to the bone by a brutal Siberian weather system in 2018 that lasted for 10 days from February 26 and saw temperatures plunge to -10C. This documentary uses news archive, video footage and interviews with celebrities to reflect on this extreme weather event, featuring contributions from actress Laila Morse, MasterChef host Gregg Wallace, Countryfiles Adam Henson and BBC meteorologist Tomasz Schafernaker

programme.title: Prince Edward: The Reliable Royal
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at the life of the Kings youngest brother, who grew up vilified by the press but has become a cornerstone of the monarchy. Things began to turn bad for the young royal when, only four months into his Royal Marines training course, news emerged he wanted out. And when he started a media career, first as a production assistant at Andrew Lloyd Webbers theatre company, then with his ill-advised Its a Royal Knockout, he became something of a laughingstock. But in later years, with his marriage to Sophie, fatherhood and greater attention to his royal duties, he has become much loved by the public

programme.title: Royal Heirs and Spares: Rivalry and Resentment
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the rivalries between royal heirs and their siblings, tracing the evolving dynamic between those born into unequal destinies from the early 20th century to today. The programme examines the tensions loyalties and comparisons that have defined these relationships, with the well-documented issues between Prince William and Prince Harry bringing the Heir and Spare dynamic into the digital age. Featuring interviews with royal historians, commentators and those who have worked behind palace walls, the film offers fresh insights into how these rivalries have shaped both the individuals involved and the public perception of the monarchy

programme.title: Exclusive: Prince Andrew and the Epstein Email Scandal
programme.desc: Documentary examining the recent revelation about a messsage sent from Prince Andrew to Jeffrey Epstein long after he claimed to have cut ties with the convicted sex offender. Featuring an interview with Daphne Barak, who wrote the article exposing the email in the Mail on Sunday, as well as journalists Nick Payne and Amy Jones

programme.title: The 1970s: Those Were the Days
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary looking back at what it was like living through the early 1970s in Britain, featuring news stories, fads, fashions and essential items of the decade. The programme covers everything from Marc Bolan and David Bowie establishing the new era of glam rock to kids obsessing over toys and transport like Clackers, Choppers and space hoppers. With contributions from Shaun Ryder, Anneka Rice, Anthea Turner, Wayne Sleep, Courtney Pine, Charlie Higson, Zoe Lyons and Samira Ahmed

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling for viewers

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands investigate the Pendle Witch trials of 1612. The presenters visit Lancaster Castle, where the suspects were held, read James Is infamous book on demons, and talk to archaeologists who claim to have found the site of the supposed covens meeting place. Plus, a look at the role a nine-year-old girl played in sealing the fates of the accused women and how the trial influenced British legal history

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands visit Sherwood Forest to learn more about the legend of Robin Hood - who may or may not have been real - and King John, who definitely was. An archaeological team digs the land surrounding the ruins of King Johns palace at Clipstone in the heart of the forest, hoping to reveal how far the royal buildings stretched. Helen and Alex also visit several of Robin Hoods supposed hideouts, as well as Nottingham Castle, where he is reputed to have been imprisoned before escaping via a secret tunnel

programme.title: Paul Martins Antiques Showdown

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

The second day sees Leigh and Toni preparing their Italian-themed menu in the tiny galley of their barge, but the biggest worry is the rabbit main course. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is forced to teach a course at the university, and Howard surprises the gang when he decides to enrol on it. Meanwhile, Amy plays Penny and Bernadette off against each other while the tension brews over Pennys new job. Comedy, guest starring Regina King (Southland), with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is forced to eat bland food after he burns his taste buds while trying to copy a fire-eating street performer. He becomes a regular at Springfield Elementarys canteen where he learns a new parenting technique to try out on Bart and Lisa - but its overbearing nature leads to disaster. Meanwhile, Marge enjoys a sauna she discovers in the basement

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Were on the Road to Dohwhere
programme.desc: Homer is forced to drive Bart to a discipline camp in another state, meaning he has to miss out on a trip to Las Vegas with Moe and the gang. While they are away, Marge decides to hold a yard sale - but ends up getting arrested as a suspected drug dealer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets trapped in a cave after trying to acquire a piece of stalactite during a family walk, leaving Marge, Maggie and Bart to go in search of help. As they wait, Lisa passes the time by telling her father a long and very strange tale in which she seeks refuge at Mr Burns mansion

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns sends Homer to train new workers in India, where he is worshipped and granted control of the plant. Meanwhile, Patty and Selma kidnap McGyver star Richard Dean Anderson - who provides his own voice - from a Stargate SG-1 convention to teach him a lesson

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When plans for an outing to the Frying Dutchman are ruined, the family tries to salvage the night by recounting three stories about disasters at sea. One of the tales told is about a fugitive called Homer who delivered the Mayflower safely to the New World

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A mix of series favourites and some of Britains best-loved LGBTQ+ personalities - including Rylan and his mother Linda, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Scott Mills and Sam Ryder, Duncan James and Denise van Outen, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Paul Sinha and his husband Oliver - take to their sofas, ready to share their views with the nation for a very special Pride anniversary episode. First shown in July 2022

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Wheel of Fortune, Trigger Point, Michael McIntyres Big Show, Boarders, Love Is Blind and The Pet Psychic: Whats Your Dog Thinking? They also reflect on BBC News coverage of UK by-elections and Donald Trumps bid to take the White House. From February 2024

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: One Day, Married at First Sight Australia, The Apprentice, Boarders and The Rescue are among the shows appraised by the amateur critics. They also offer their thoughts of ITVs news coverage of MP Lee Anderson, following controversial comments he made regarding London Mayor Sadiq Khan. From March 2024

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Podiatrist Felicity meets handsome city boy Jethro, who describes himself as Marmite, while 24-year-old Irishman Damian believes his Tourettes is the reason he has yet to find the man of his dreams. He goes on a date with part-time model Kai, who is a sucker for an Irish accent. Meanwhile, 79-year-old history student Joe has a poignant and cheeky date with Dee, boat builder Abbey swaps her overalls for a dress in a bid to win the heart of special effects technicians James, and accountant Ajai meets his date Hema

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Croydon mates Josh and Jack take part in a double date, but problems arise after they meet Morgan and Jasmine, and both fall for the same girl. Meanwhile, divorced mum-of-two Sandy hopes to find romance with an astrology expert Steve, though incompatible star signs may be a problem. And tomboy boat-builder Abbey returns to the restaurant, but will she find a soul mate in Eddie, an odd job man whos nervous around women?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Wheel of Fortune, Trigger Point, Michael McIntyres Big Show, Boarders, Love Is Blind and The Pet Psychic: Whats Your Dog Thinking? They also reflect on BBC News coverage of UK by-elections and Donald Trumps bid to take the White House. From February 2024

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: One Day, Married at First Sight Australia, The Apprentice, Boarders and The Rescue are among the shows appraised by the amateur critics. They also offer their thoughts of ITVs news coverage of MP Lee Anderson, following controversial comments he made regarding London Mayor Sadiq Khan. From March 2024

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his sons entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesakes magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Oceans fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer begins the final leg of his journey on the northern tip of Sumatra in western Indonesia, near the epicentre of the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, finding out how the province of Banda Aceh has undergone many changes since the disaster. He also explores the illegal trade in exotic pets in the Indonesian capital of Jakarta, before heading for Australia, the final country on his epic journey. There he visits the unspoilt wilderness of the Kimberley region, meets a crocodile hunter and goes fishing with natives campaigning to stop the construction of a giant gas plant

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: Originally broadcast live from the Arctic, this series follows the struggles of polar bears living on this frozen tundra and highlights the impact that environmental changes are having on the bears and the changing world around them. Simon Reeve, Kate Humble and Gordon Buchanan examine the effects of climate change and the struggles these bears now face as the sea ice continues to melt at an alarming rate

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: The team presents more news from the remote Canadian town of Churchill on the edge of the Arctic. Gordon Buchanan meets the people who protect the town from polar bears, Simon Reeves goes to Greenland to meet NASA scientists monitoring the melting of glaciers, and Kate travels to Sweden to round up some reindeer

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At Trinity College, Dublin, Michael Portillo discovers one of Irelands greatest treasures, and also explores the house and gardens of Powerscourt in County Wicklow

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaws guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the citys textile heritage, and also investigates Bradfords musical heritage

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conway attends a council meeting where his attempts to make changes on the Jasmine Allen estate results in a riot

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When Ramsey investigates a theft at a library, CID discover the man rumoured to be behind the theft is a gangster from Manchester

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of natures evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds nests to the deaths-head hawkmoth stealing honey

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that talk to bees using electrical signals

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: A group of lowly British Merchant Navy sailors save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it was almost destroyed by the enemy, They brave fire and ocean to sail the the vessel 900 miles to the safety of a Scottish port. Drama, starring Walter Fitzgerald, Mervyn Johns and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wealthy and ambitious cattleman plans to seize all the land surrounding his own. A peaceful rancher living nearby ignores warnings to sell up and avoid a conflict, and as he suffers a campaign of intimidation, he is forced to adopt violent methods to defend his livelihood. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: A female Russian pilot defects to the West due to anger at sexual discrimination in the Soviet Air Force. A US Air Force officer tries to convince the committed communist of the benefits of life in the West and romance blossoms - but the KGB are soon stalking the couple. Comedy, starring Bob Hope, Katharine Hepburn, James Robertson Justice and Robert Helpmann

programme.title: Turner and Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detectives well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: Anna
programme.desc: A young Russian woman who is the victim of domestic abuse reluctantly accepts an offer from the KGB, and soon becomes one of the worlds most feared killers. Action thriller written, produced and directed by Luc Besson, and starring Sasha Luss, Helen Mirren, Luke Evans and Cillian Murphy

programme.title: The Black Phone
programme.desc: In 1970s North Denver, a masked predator nicknamed The Grabber poses as a magician to lure unsuspecting children into the back of his van. Five youngsters vanish without trace despite the best efforts of Detectives Wright and Miller to identify a prime suspect. Their enquiries lead to Gwen Shaw, an abused girl who claims to have prophetic dreams about the missing boys. Horror, starring Mason Thames, Ethan Hawke, Madeleine McGraw and Jeremy Davies

programme.title: Berberian Sound Studio
programme.desc: An introverted sound engineer used to working on nature documentaries is recruited by an Italian director, only to find himself working on a violent horror movie. The alien surroundings and constant repetition of disturbing imagery begins to take its toll on his sanity. Thriller, starring Toby Jones, Tonia Sotiropoulou and Antonio Mancino

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owners son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Childrens fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
programme.desc: In 1998, magazine journalist Lloyd Vogel is sent to interview beloved TV entertainer Fred Rogers, an assignment he feels is beneath him. However, a friendship soon forms between the two men. Director Marielle Hellers drama based on a true story, starring an Oscar and Bafta-nominated Tom Hanks, Matthew Rhys and Chris Cooper

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: In 1987, lonely Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father and resentful of her mother Sallys relationship with new boyfriend Ronald. For her 18th-birthday shes given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In the 11th century, a group of Europeans set out for China to discover how to make gunpowder. However, on arrival their claims to be on a trading mission are disbelieved and they are arrested and imprisoned by the Nameless Order within the Great Wall - just as it is about to be beset by giant, lizard-like monsters. As wave after wave of attacks and surprise tactics batter the Wall, Europeans and Chinese battle hordes of the creatures in a series of escalating conflicts leading to a final confrontation with the alien queen. Fantasy adventure, starring Matt Damon, Willem Dafoe and Tian Jing

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: After an outlaw unknowingly leads a band of cannibalistic cave-dwellers into the peaceful town of Bright Hope, the elderly sheriff rounds up a posse to rescue townsfolk abducted by the ferocious tribesmen. Western horror, starring Kurt Russell and Patrick Wilson

programme.title: In Fear
programme.desc: A couple go to Ireland for a music festival, but get hopelessly lost when driving through a series of country roads. Their plight turns deadly as they are terrorised by mysterious figures lurking in the darkness, while an encounter with a seemingly harmless local brings dangers of its own. Horror, starring Iain De Caestecker, Alice Englert and Allen Leech

programme.desc: After Clay kills a cattle baron who forced a gunfight, the people from the ranchers hometown plan to execute him for murder

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Harris Claibourne is challenged to a duel after discovering gambler Raoul de Moreney is a well known hustler who has killed many men

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: A US Army officer, once branded a coward after hesitating during a battle, is entrusted with transporting a group of supposed military heroes on a long and gruelling trek back to base in 1916 Mexico. However, the men soon reveal their true and less than heroic colours, leaving the disgraced soldier to show them who is boss. Adventure, starring Gary Cooper, Rita Hayworth, Van Heflin and Richard Conte

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh goes after an elephant trainer who used the animal to scare away the townspeople, leaving him free to commit a robbery. Steve McQueen stars

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Buck unknowingly hires a group of army deserters at the same time an army patrol stops at High Chaparral documenting fights with the Apaches. When a troop takes high level Apache hostages, Cochise returns the favour by staging an attack

programme.title: The Persuaders!
programme.desc: Brett and Danny are unprepared for what they discover while on a camping holiday. Vintage adventure series, starring Tony Curtis and Roger Moore

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed finds himself prime suspect when foreign agents are suddenly systematically killed off, so initiates a truce with his Russian opposite and together they work to discover the identity of the killers

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: The crime-busting trio leap into action to investigate a series of mysterious deaths involving fellow secret agents. Tongue-in-cheek espionage adventure, with Patrick Macnee, Joanna Lumley and Gareth Hunt

programme.title: Missing in Action 2
programme.desc: A crusading American soldier is captured by Vietnamese forces while on a mission to rescue PoWs. However, he stages a daring escape and leads his brutalised countrymen through the jungle in search of freedom. Action adventure prequel, starring Chuck Norris, Soon-Teck Oh, Cosie Costa and Steven Williams

programme.title: Breakout
programme.desc: Two teenagers on a camping trip are pursued by a pair of murderers, who believe the youngsters have witnessed their latest killing. However, the hunters become the hunted when the kids convict father escapes from prison to come to their rescue. Action thriller, starring Brendan Fraser and Dominic Purcell

programme.title: This Week Back Then

programme.desc: A woman looking for some time alone following a bad break-up arranges to spend Christmas staying with her uncle on his remote ranch. Romantic drama, starring Kristoffer Polaha and Lindy Booth

programme.desc: Passionate artist Andys family has been building floats for Californias annual New Year Rose Parade for generations. When her father falls ill ahead of the occasion, she is forced to step in to oversee the construction and decoration of a lucrative clients big float. To make matters worse, said client is demanding young businessman Cliff, who makes it clear failure to deliver is not an option. Romantic drama, starring Rachel Boston

Begrudgingly, she agrees to teach the businessman who is taking over the company everything she knows about its workings, and ends up falling for him. Festive romantic drama, starring Malone Thomas and Jason Burkey

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The constabulary are on guard as the village is plagued by a series of mysterious explosions, while a redundant church provides Vernon and David with their next fortune-hunting endeavour. Nostalgic drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local boy DS Ben Jones is a mine of information for his boss DCI Barnaby when a reclusive elderly couple are murdered in their home and a spate of killings appears to be linked to both a fatal road accident and the disappearance of a teenager 20 years earlier. programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead mans brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dollys husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a music masterclass led by a renowned pianist, a shy prodigy suffers a panic attack and runs off to a nearby river. To her horror, she witnesses a woman drowning and a baby left on the riverbank. But when Barnaby arrives, there is no sign of the victim - and he is struck by similarities to another mysterious case that happened 20 years ago at the same spot. Guest starring veteran actor James Fox and Coronation Streets Ian Puleston-Davies (Owen Armstrong), alongside former Corrie star Richard Fleeshman (Craig Harris)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local boxer John Kinsellas successful world title bid stirs up hidden passions among the residents of Midsomer Morchard. As plans to stage a celebratory re-enactment of a Victorian prizefight shape up, jealousy, betrayal and blackmail take a ringside seat, while two suspicious deaths suggest Barnaby has let friendship cloud his judgement. Detective drama, guest starring Phil Daniels (Quadrophenia, EastEnders), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Anglers flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake. Following the bitterness, fishing hooks and barbs are discovered hidden within the race obstacles before someone is found fatally electrocuted. Barnaby is left working out whether his death was another part of a sabotage gone wrong. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon

programme.title: Vera

The bones are identified as belonging to a fellow cop, leading Vera to uncover a web of dark secrets as she looks into her dead colleagues fraud squad. Brenda Blethyn dons her familiar hat and mac to play Vera in this mystery, based on the characters created by Ann Cleeves

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The inspector and his sidekick DS Hathaway investigate the murder of a talented maths student. programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlanes beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: A widow needs help to clear her late husbands collection of militaria. Plus, a couple hope a Chinese warlord will fund a much-needed holiday

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Irita Marriott rummage around the antique shops of Wiltshire and Dorset. James goes on a journey back to the land before time where he meets a famous fossil hunter. Irita takes a break from shopping to visit the site of the once-great Shaftesbury Abbey

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Prior to attending the final auction, James Braxton learns about the brave Polish night fighter pilots who defended Exeter from the German Luftwaffe during the Second World War and Irita Marriott goes behind the scenes of a beloved local cinema as its brought back to life. James is excited by his discovery of a snuff box with a connection to the abolitionist movement, but will it be enough to secure a victory?

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Cornwall to help Sean and Janine, the owners of Northshore, Budes only hostel. Having returned from travelling the world, the pair bought the property to keep their travelling dream alive. Running the hostel is the best job Seans ever had - but a shocking downturn in occupancy and their unorthodox living scenario have left Janine wanting out. programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Stanley visits Umbria, nicknamed the Green Heart of Italy. While this small, predominantly rural region lives in the shadow of its more glamorous neighbour Tuscany, Umbria has an ancient history that predates even the Romans. With the highest consumption of pork per capita in Italy, Umbria is a carnivores dream. From wild-boar hunts to incredible black truffle farms, Tucci explores the riches this land has to offer

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey in the East Yorkshire resort of Hornsea, famous for its distinctive pottery. In Hull, he discovers how one of Hull FCs star players made history as Britains first black rugby captain. From Hull, Michael hitches a ride on a fine-looking barge heading to Goole on a network of canals. At Spurn Point, Michael hears how along this coast an ingenious 19th-century RNLI invention saved many lives

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has reached Lincolnshire, where his coastal railway journey from Middlesbrough ends. In Grimsby Town, he investigates a new stage in the towns history - as a maintenance base for some of the largest wind farms in the world. In neighbouring Cleethorpes, Michael rides on the Cleethorpes Coast Light Railway, pulled by a miniature steam locomotive. Later, Michael makes for a curious and wild stretch of coastline at Humberston

programme.title: Disco: Soundtrack of a Revolution
programme.desc: The story of the global music phenomenon, beginning with its roots in the gay and black communities in the loft apartments and basement bars of 1970s New York when a new generation of DJs pioneered a distinct sound and a new way of spinning records. As the city - and the country - was mired in political and economic misery, these underground clubs represented a form of escapism, with pulsating, hedonistic dancefloors defined by a sense of sexual liberation

programme.desc: Life in some of the many deserts and grasslands around the world, including in the baked Namib desert, where a pair of ostriches raise their family in the searing heat to keep them safe from predators. One troop of desert baboons are on a continual quest to find water and a young mother who is low in the pecking order must battle for her right to drink. Closer to the equator, in the grassland paradise of the Cerrado in Brazil, lives the rare, fruit-eating maned wolf, a bizarre creature about whom little is known

programme.title: Hitler Youth
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at the expansion of the organisation in the build-up to war, and the efforts of the Allies to counter the indoctrination of captured Nazi soldiers

programme.title: Hurricanes From Above

programme.title: Training Day

Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Scott Glenn and Tom Berenger

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A man tries to deal with his insomnia by visiting a psychiatrist, and recounts a recurring dream he has about the death of his wife

programme.desc: A look at the extraordinary musical longevity of the British-American rock band, which begin in 1967 under the leadership of guitarist Peter Green. It was when Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks joined in 1974 that the band reached superstardom with the releases of albums including Rumours and Tusk, but the group was riven with internal problems due to affairs and drug abuse

programme.desc: A womans eye transplant leads her lover to see her in a new light. Starring Amanda Redman and Anthony Valentine

programme.desc: A man discovers that his business partner has fraudulently embezzled at least $60,000 from their company, and warns him that if he does not repay the money promptly, criminal charges will be pressed that should result in a lengthy prison sentence. However, his crooked former friend already plans to fake his death and escape with the cash. Drama, starring Richard Anderson, Steven Hill and Joanna Moore

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: A married man finds his beautiful mistress murdered and flees without reporting the crime and soon becomes the victim of a blackmailer. Dark drama, starring Patrick ONeal and Kathie Brown

programme.title: Hitchcock on Grierson
programme.desc: Alfred Hitchcocks 1970 profile in which he pays tribute to pioneering documentary-maker John Grierson, exploring what made his work so extraordinary and influential

programme.desc: Documentary reflecting on the actors legacy, addressing questions such as his self-belief, alcoholism, relationships with women, belief in socialism and selective embrace of Irishness. Featuring interviews with Anthony Hopkins, Derek Jacobi and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Portrait Artist of the Year
programme.sub-title: James May, Billy Porter, Emma Barnett
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan invites nine artists to paint celebrity sitters James May, Billy Porter and Emma Barnett as Tai Shan Schierenberg, Kathleen Soriano and Kate Bryan judge the efforts

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Music critics discuss the rise of the band, who were put together for a TV show and had hits including Im a Believer and Daydream Believer

programme.title: Paul McCartney and Wings: One Hand Clapping
programme.desc: Documentary filmed over four days at Abbey Road Studios in 1974, revealing the inner workings of the band and featuring performances of Maybe Im Amazed, Jet and Live and Let Die

programme.title: How the Beatles Changed the World
programme.desc: Through exclusive interviews and a wealth of rarely seen footage, this film reveals the previously untold story of how four young men from Liverpool transformed the world for ever

programme.title: Lennons Last Weekend
programme.desc: A look at the musicians final interview, given to Radio 1 DJ Andy Peebles two days before the former Beatle was murdered, intertwined with footage and commentary from friends

programme.title: Stuart Sutcliffe: The Lost Beatle
programme.desc: Profile of the less well-known member of the group. Sutcliffe met John Lennon at art college, and played bass on their early tours of Scotland and Germany. However, he left the band to study art in Hamburg, and ultimately died of a brain haemorrhage before they became famous. Part of the Liverpool on the Box week

programme.title: The Stones in Exile
programme.desc: Alan Yentob visits France to introduce a film documenting the recording of the Rolling Stones 1972 album Exile on Main Street. Having faced ruin due to the size of their unpaid tax bills, the Stones relocated to the French Riviera to make the album, before completing the recording in Los Angeles - with Mick Jagger also finding time to get married in St Tropez. Alongside rare home-movie footage of the band at work, there are also interviews with Jagger, Keith Richards, Bill Wyman and Charlie Watts

programme.title: Johnson and Knopflers Music Legends
programme.desc: Brian Johnson and Mark Knopfler visit guitarist Carlos Santana, discussing his incredible journey in music from the early days through to his resurgence in the late-1990s

programme.title: The Great Songwriters
programme.desc: Linda Perry, formerly of 4 Non Blondes, discusses the art of songwriting and performs a selection of her hits, including Beautiful and Whats Up?

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Former Velvet Underground singer Lou Reed discusses the making of his 1972 album Transformer, which features tracks including Perfect Day and Walk on the Wild Side. The programme also includes recollections by producers David Bowie and Mick Ronson

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britains grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of Londons most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell)

In Chicago, Al Capone is out for vengeance after a police officer shoots his brother Frank, while Margaret supports herself in New York by luring clients into a property trust scheme, but her life gets complicated when Rothstein turns up

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Nuckys alcohol shipment from Florida contains something he didnt order, while a frustrated Agent Knox gets a break in his investigation into the Atlantic City kingpin when he hears how Willie avoided jail for the Temple University students death with the help of his uncle. Meanwhile, Chalky tries to regain control over his part of town and declares war on Dr Narcisse and his heroin business

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: The body of a girl is found with a broken rib which punctured her lung and 26 belt buckle marks on her body. Bayliss reveals his own childhood abuse to Pembleton.

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: The team investigate the killing of an Asian shopkeeper who tried to forbid dope dealers from operating outside his store. His killing leads detectives to Mahoney, whose parting shot to Kellerman throws the detective into a tailspin of depression

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire

The Pembletons marriage seems to be disintegrating in spite of therapy, while Lewis and Cox wait outside an office where a third bomb has been delivered.
