programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Queens Park Rangers v Millwall (Kick-off 12.30pm). Coverage of the Championship match from MATRADE Loftus Road Stadium. The visitors have done well recently against their hosts having won three of the last five meetings between the two teams. Millwall won the last fixture between the sides 2-1 back in early February as all three goals were scored inside the opening 25 minutes

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: New Zealand v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R.Premadasa Stadium, Colombo. New Zealand are playing in their 13th consecutive World Cup and won the event for the one and only time back in 2000 when they beat rivals Australia by just four runs. Pakistan are appearing in their fifth successive tournament and sixth overall, and have never got as far as the quarter-finals before

programme.title: Live: SNF
programme.desc: Fulham v Arsenal (Kick-off 5.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Craven Cottage. The visitors have a strong recent record against Fulham, having only lost once to the Cottagers in the last 14 meetings between the two teams. That sole defeat came back on New Years Eve 2023 as the hosts came from behind to win 2-1. Raul Jimenez and Bobby Decorva-Reid scored either side of the break to cancel out Bukayo Sakas fifth-minute opener

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: This documentary series follows the investigations of unique specialist units within UK police forces created to crack tough cases ranging from cyber heists, romance fraud and people trafficking to drug rings and murder. With unique access to some of Britain’s most talented detectives, the series explores their investigations, their methods, and the evidence that has put some of the UK’s most dangerous criminals behind bars. Each episode features unique evidential police footage as they take on the criminals and hunt for clues to solve the cases and experiences first-hand the work of these elite units on the front line while witnessing their bravery, skill, and compassion amid tragedy and loss. The series also discover how detectives operate in the interview room, how forensics bring a case into focus, and how expert CCTV and digital analysis create timelines and evidence to catch a criminal and the impact these crimes have on the communities they serve

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond tests Volkswagens Touareg off-roader, before driving a racing version of the car against a group of snowmobile riders in Sweden. programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef takes a gastronomic road trip to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a melting pot of East and West. His journey begins in the city of Venice, and on the idyllic Greek island of Symi he cooks some of his favourite Venetian dishes including seafood risotto, tiramisu and gnocchi with spider crab

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Driving up Madagascars eastern coast at the tail end of the rainy season is enough to test the best of friendships, but comedy actor Angus Deayton and broadcaster Mariella Frostrup are game enough to take on the challenge, and good enough friends to poke fun at each other along the way. The route has numerous river crossings and the duo face a variety of broken bridges and flimsy ferries as the only way across, while the roads themselves are mired with thick mud. Progress becomes increasingly painful and they are finally forced to spend a night in the car

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Twenty Twelve co-stars Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes pair up again to go on a road trip through the former Soviet republic of Georgia. Driving from the border with Azerbaijan to the Black Sea, Jessica soon discovers her spirit of adventure is causing Hugh a few moments of high anxiety, but there is worse to come when they find themselves stuck on a high mountain pass in bad weather and he has to overcome his vertigo. While the drive is a challenge all the way, the country and its people delight and surprise them at every turn

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor begins his journey at Lake Kariba in Zimbabwe, where he hunts down the vundu catfish, known locally as the steam train because of its strength. He also examines the kapenta fishing industry, which is integral to life in the country because it provides protein for the low-income populace. In Victoria Falls, he has to prove his courage when angling for tiger fish in a deep pool called the boiling pot, before braving the Zambezis white-water rapids

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Scunthorpe woman Caroline Blanchard, a single mum who has twice had to make the decision to turn off the life support for people she loves. She and her children live in the shadow of the garage, where seven-year-old Natasha banged her head in 2007, and the conservatory, where husband and father Paul had a heart attack four years later. The volunteers plan is to give them a new home for a new start, including demolishing the conservatory and garage where these two tragedies occurred

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mums untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina becomes obsessed by mortality following her fathers death and sets about assembling an art collection as a tribute to herself. Acclaimed comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, June Whitfield and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: The jet-set duo head for sunny Morocco where, after selling Saffy to slave traders, they learn a Vogue fashion shoot is a little too close for comfort. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Jo and Ash deal with a patient whose chronic cough leaves him struggling to breathe, while Joel and Nic treat a man whos fallen from a ladder while wielding a hedge trimmer

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Concern grows for Jos safety when she fails to show up for work and further study of the videotape made by Larry Franks yields vital clues to the killers identity. A frantic search begins for the missing DC when Beth discovers the evidence Rachel was examining has been stolen from the station store - and the culprit makes a break for freedom carrying a gun and ammunition

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New recruit Sergeant Callum Stone (Sam Callis) makes an instant impact at Sun Hill by subduing a violent drunk in the station, but his maverick methods instantly alarm Dan and raise Smithys hackles. Terry traces a series of threatening calls made to elderly women back to a single suspect, a supervisor at a kitchen fitting company, who is less than pleased to be arrested in a lift stalled between floors. Michael Angelis guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following a report of vandalism on a church, Terry finds himself investigating a case of assisted suicide in which conflicting evidence from the grieving family members suggests someone has something to hide. Meanwhile, Beth and Roger are called to a pet shop where the owner has been tied up and several dogs let loose, but its Sun Hills own bloodhound Callum Stone who realises there is something more sinister than youthful high-jinks going on

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A woman is robbed of her winnings on the way home from a casino, and suspicion soon falls on the barman who called her a taxi - which was driven by his friend. The case against the men grows stronger when it turns out they once before arranged transport for a woman who was attacked, so Emma Keane is sent undercover as a casino punter - only for events to take a surprising turn. Michael Brandon guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill cops spring into action when an elderly Alzheimers sufferer goes missing along with her five-month-old great-granddaughter. Jean Boht and Michael Brandon guest star

programme.desc: Following former call taker Laura on her very first shift on the road as a paramedic

programme.title: The Supervet

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary. Tendayi and Maxwell dont always agree about how to bring up their two boys, but their hectic lives are about to get even busier as theyll soon have four children living under their roof. Donna and Wayne had to endure a lengthy labour before the safe arrival of baby Emelia, and they now tackle the challenges of raising their two little girls by running a very tight ship - with Donna at the helm

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Fashionistas Heather and Daniel have seen their businesses go from strength to strength since the arrival of their daughter Eivissa, but theyve struggled to conceive again. Can their positive outlook and determination bring them the second child they long for? Also featured are first-time mum Judith, who had to cope with an anxiety disorder after going through a tricky birth, and 20-year-old Nicole, whose close-knit female family has supported her as a single mother raising baby Esmay. Fly-on-the-wall documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minutes most memorable parents

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Accused of defrauding an elderly person, Tonika has been struggling to cope in jail. She wants her husband to bail her out, but after two weeks behind bars, its the women in her anger management class who are helping her most. Cameras follow her case at Western Massachusetts Regional Womens Correctional Centre. Kathy Burke narrates

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Shoplifter and addict Linda is already planning her next big heist - stealing the ingredients for a celebratory feast when she gets out. But when jail life becomes depressingly familiar, she is forced to accept that confronting her demons may be the only way to break her cycle of addiction and crime

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues through southern California aboard the Coast Starlight rail service. In the port of Monterey, he discovers the citys Spanish and Mexican heritage, before heading to Paso de Robles, where he tours Hearst Castle, dream home of the newspaper baron, William Randolph Hearst. In the hills of Morro Bay, Michael joins avocado farmer, Jim Shanley, amid his 4,000 avocado trees to harvest the pears and learn how to make guacamole. Arriving in Los Angeles, Michael heads for the Warner Brothers studio, founded on Sunset Boulevard

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his tour of Los Angeles, joining the locals for Mexican Independence Day, and discovering the secrets of backyard oil drilling in a county that is home to the largest urban oil field in the US. Moving on to Laguna Beach, he learns how artists from the east coast travelled west on the Transcontinental Railroad to found a colony of painters attracted by the beautiful coastline and glorious light to paint outside

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor hires a daily to help out around the house, but comes to regret his decision, and a visit to the fish shop unleashes all manner of horrors. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giless Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The history of the steeplejacks favourite sites, beginning with his home town of Bolton, which was a hive of busy factories during the 1940s and 1950s when Britain led the industrialised world

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A look at the Bolton steeplejacks back garden, which housed one of the best examples of a steam-powered engineering workshop in the country, built using scrap from old mills and factories

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack investigates traditional craftsmanship in Yorkshire and Derbyshire, including glass-cutting, making rivets using the traditional hot forge method, and ornate carving. programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain

programme.desc: Fellow chef Paul Rankin gives James a personal tour of Northern Irelands capital city - his home town of Belfast - before the duo enjoy a spot of golf. James pitches up his mobile kitchen right on the green to whip up a tasty dish with bacon, scallops and apples with onion rings, and later cooks a Northern Irish classic - beef with champ, charred onions and parsley oil. Next, James is in Craigavon to visit Danni Barry, the first woman named the best chef in Ireland, who rustles up a dessert using local ingredients. Finally, the presenter visits Strangford Lough to fish for langoustines

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

If the contestants meet expectations they will get the money, but fall short and the cash is split between the other teams

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: Cassie battles to keep control of her store, while bringing her magic to bear in her efforts to help Sam retain custody of his son Nick

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Best friends and work colleagues Luke and Jack, and couple Amber and John face a series of games that puts all their skills to the test as they attempt to beat the Cube. The further they go in the competition, the more money they win, up to a jackpot of £250,000. Phillip Schofield hosts

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli joins John and Lisa to show them his homemade pasta dish served with pine nuts and asparagus, while John creates a Thai noodle salad and banoffee pie

programme.title: Animal Emergency
programme.desc: Old English sheepdog puppy Jessie has narrowly avoided death but now must undergo emergency surgery. Elsewhere in the hospital, owner Alan is determined to give his 13-year-old crossbreed Jessica as comfortable life as possible as she battles terminal kidney disease. Coco the alsatian is examined to see if she is a candidate to become a blood donor ,while Mary the heifer is operated on to correct a problem with her leg

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Nuala spends the morning pregnancy-testing the livestock on her family farm, where her father and brother tend 200 dairy cows. Jennie attends Minnie the Jack Russell, who has delivered one of her pups, with more still to come. However, Minnies labour has slowed dangerously and Jennie has to act fast if she is to save the lives of the rest of the litter - leading to a difficult decision for owner Jamie. Meanwhile, an emergency case leaves Darren delivering two sets of twins

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a nine-month-old terrier who was found wandering the streets whilst heavily pregnant, before spending time with a three-month-old puppy called Pancake, who is having problems with his eyesight. Elsewhere, a dog arrives at Battersea who was found dumped with a terrible case of mange and an injured leg

programme.title: Puppy Secrets: The First Six Months
programme.desc: The puppies leave their litters behind and move to their new homes with their new owners. Collie puppies Jack and Jill are chosen by one of Britains top sheepdog trainers, and Neave is picked to train as an assistance dog to help change the life of a disabled person. As the puppies approach six months, there is an update on how well they have taken to their training in this crucial stage of their development

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team head to Somerset to work with Vicki and Bryan, who dream of spending less time at work and more time with their young family by turning a corner of their field into a unique BandB. They have a space-age geodome, but have no idea how to transform it into a welcoming rental. Simon and his team are full of ideas, including a large wooden statement bed and set of bunks, plus a botanical theme to bring warmth and colour to the large space. Its a big and physically challenging job, but with help from friends and family the team hopes to pull off an extraordinary transformation

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team are on a mission to prove to the nation that you can achieve the home renovation of your dreams without it literally costing the earth. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as 2 households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week. Each family has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie travels to Milton Keynes to help a former chiropractor clear out his mountainous stash of possessions, which includes an intriguing sketch. Plus, she tries to persuade a busy mother to summon the energy to sort through her box-filled garage

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: When psychiatric registrar James Ford finds himself torn between a new mother attending a routine postnatal check-up and the sectioning of a psychotic woman during a busy on-call shift, no-one can predict the terrible consequences. The MIU are brought in to investigate, but digging deeper into the events that night leads to questions about Dr Ford and his hospital department. Medical thriller, starring Tom Hughes, Helen Behan and Jordan Kouame

programme.title: Criminal Assets Bureau
programme.desc: Part two of two. A week after the murder of Veronica Guerin in June 1996, the Oireachtas passed the Proceeds of Crime Bill, and by October the Criminal Assets Bureau (CAB) was a fully functioning agency of the state. Since then CAB has completely changed the way organised crime is policed and become a blueprint for fighting organised crime on an international level. For the almost 50 per cent of the population under 35, this is ancient history. This series looks at the agencys first 25 years and shows the Irish public CABs importance at both a national and international level, especially its role as a model for seizing the assets of organised crime worldwide

Mels faith in Phoenix is brought into question, Jonathan has an outrageous idea for how Honey can turn an impediment into an advantage, and Chloe shares her dads tendency to expose himself in the Madeley kitchen. Romesh also teaches his mum Shanthi how to deliver bad news to a Spice Girl

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police leap into action when a labourer at the Kirkbys farm dies of strychnine poisoning, believing a killer is on the loose. As the finger of suspicion moves from one villager to another, the scene is set for tragedy. Meanwhile, the Ashfordly Rotary Club pensioners head for the seaside town of Whitby - but Davids mangy mutt Alfred proves to be something of a liability

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus decides to bring in some sheep in order to produce his favourite meat - lamb. A trip to his native Lancashire introduces him to the amazing Lonk sheep, famed for their delicious meat. Back at the smallholding, while waiting for his new sheep to arrive, he learns about growing ones own spices from chilli enthusiast Mothin and batches up some tomato sauce to share at the local food bank. Once his sheep have arrived, he cooks up a meaty feast for the people who have helped him along the way

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: An anonymous enemy goes all out to ruin Wycliffe by sending the police a batch of photos apparently showing him taking bribes. As soon as she hears the news, Lane puts an investigation into the deaths of two drug-dealers on hold and leaps to her bosss defence - risking her career in the process. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the clients refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: When the Green Woods Laugh - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop can barely contain his glee as his beloved Mariettes wedding draws closer, until a summons from the magistrate threatens to turn it into a far from `perfick" day. Whimsical drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the murder of Julie Archer by her brother Stephen, who set fire to her in her Greater Manchester home in 2016. Police had their chief suspect almost immediately, but Stephen went on the run, posing an enormous danger to the public at large

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A gang of elderly villains spot a chance for one last, glorious crime spree when the villagers leave Aidensfield en masse to support Rob in a charity football match. Peg finally gives David a bit of support when it turns out his jury duty is more trouble than he imagined. Rural police drama, starring Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Ruth Watson visits the award-winning Tasburgh Hotel in Bath in a bid to discover why the establishment has a distinct lack of guests. She meets the BandBs owner Sue, and tries to convince her that no amount of classy decor can make up for the cramped bedrooms full of soft toys, dingy bathrooms, poor presentation and a steep starting price of £110 per night

programme.title: Dr Ranj: On Call
programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, he joins the West Midlands Ambulance Service to help with emergency calls, while Kylie Pentelow meets a young patient whose life was saved thanks to incredible advancements in 3D printing

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dylan and April are pushed into dangerous situations, while a suggestion from Joe brings more conflict and Robert lies to Aaron

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dylan and April are pushed into dangerous situations, while a suggestion from Joe brings more conflict and Robert lies to Aaron

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin comes to the aid of a man brought in with a leg injury which his friend claims was sustained in an agricultural accident, but it soon emerges he is actually suffering a gunshot wound - prompting his panic-stricken acquaintance to pull a revolver on the hospital staff. Meanwhile, Ormerod helps fossil collectors hurt in a landslide, Matron tries to convince Sister Brigid to return to work and student nurse Samantha Beaumont is less than impressed at the offer of a date with Alun Morris. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox, Tony Pitts, Denis Lill, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A college dean is found bludgeoned to death in local woodland, following a heated pub debate. When an alchemic image is discovered by the body, denoting the first of four stages of a process called `The Magnum Opus", the detectives realise that there are three more murders to follow. Before any more crimes are committed, the team must uncover the guilty secret that the victims share in order to learn the identity of the killer and the potential victims

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Helen is accused of helping an elderly, terminally ill patient to die, a problem compounded by the strain of concealing her relationship with Rob. Meanwhile, Peggy and David go into business selling stolen strawberries - unaware that Geoff Younger is hot on their trail. Rural drama, with Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor, David Lonsdale and Steven Blakeley

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: The success of the Allied advance in Libya is undone when the Italian forces receive German reinforcements, leaving Stan and Rajib forced to beat a hasty retreat across the desert. Marga attends a maternity home and finds her commitment to the cause invigorated, despite an encounter with a traumatised fellow patient exposing her to some difficult truths. David is selected to fly a dangerous mission over France

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: DI Costello wields his power over Betsy after shes arrested and Bethanys first day at the salon doesnt go to plan. Bernies blood boils over Naomi and Tracy comes up with a plan to get Cassie out of her hair and back into Fizs good books

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: DI Costello wields his power over Betsy after shes arrested and Bethanys first day at the salon doesnt go to plan. Bernies blood boils over Naomi and Tracy comes up with a plan to get Cassie out of her hair and back into Fizs good books

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn tells Joe her history, while April faces a terrifying future and Nicola and Laurel come to a realisation

programme.title: Dark Heart
programme.desc: The detectives continue to look into a string of attacks on a series of people who were marked as paedophiles but never convicted, although Wagstaffe is frustrated by the eerie wall of silence from the victims families. To make matters worse, a web of deceit begins to unravel - leading the DI to a disturbing conclusion. Crime drama, starring Tom Riley, Kobna Holdbrook-Smith and Charlotte Riley

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Frank is playing golf when a local newspaper reporter turns up dead in one of the bunkers, and the chief superintendent and Blake soon discover a link to local politics

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A witchcraft scare sweeps through Aidensfield, but Greengrass, who clearly subscribes to the old adage that where theres muck theres money, is too preoccupied with a new get-rich-quick scheme to care _ he is convinced the hidden properties of local mud are about to make him a fortune. Bill Maynard stars as the rascally rustic

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A baby is kidnapped from outside the post office, causing emotions to run high in Aidensfield. Greengrass agrees to concrete a drive to earn extra cash, but makes the mistake of hiring a helper who proves less than adept. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds, Jason Durr and Kazia Pelka

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.sub-title: Give a Dog a Bad Name
programme.desc: Craddock wins few friends in the local farming community while trying to implement the newly introduced breathalyser, and Blaketon investigates an outbreak of fleas in the village. Elsewhere, a new addition to the station leaves Bellamy feeling like a lovesick puppy. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds, Philip Franks and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news documentary looking back at the headline stories of the past 20 years, focusing this week on 2016

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola and Jimmy are anxious about Carls impending police interview, Moira is struggling with Cains absence, and Victoria reminds Robert he still needs to tell Aaron about Kev

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain returns, but he is not in a good place, while Robert is in a quandary and Laurel makes an admission

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn tells Joe her history, while April faces a terrifying future and Nicola and Laurel come to a realisation

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef explores new possibilities for his East Sussex small holding by planting a hedgerow to encourage wildlife, before heading over to Mersea Island in Essex to go crab fishing

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: This time, the comedian meets an agoraphobic dog that is too scared to go outside, before an unusually quiet chihuahua arrives with a suspected injury to its leg. Later, Paul is introduced to a group of four Japanese chin crosses who have not being getting on well with each other and need to be separated

programme.title: Ainsleys National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Yvonne Cobb and Rupy Aujla at Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley collects greengages and plums for his brioche French toast, chargrilled plums and cinnamon creme fraiche, Yvonne adds delicious flavour hacks to a creamy tarragon chicken and French bean salad with roasted rosemary potatoes, and Rupy talks up the health benefits of his grilled mackerel, roasted apple, radish and chilli and pea pesto

programme.title: Coronation Street: 50 Years, 50 Moments
programme.desc: Victoria Wood narrates the concluding part of the documentary counting down the soaps best storylines over its first half-century, as voted for by fans. Featuring interviews with cast members past and present and classic highlights since the beginning of the show in 1960

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: As Frances and Joyce battle for leadership of the new group, the others face problems of a much more personal nature. Erica and Wills relationship is tested after his cancer diagnosis, Pat is struggling with her unhappy marriage and Miriam has one last chance to stop David enlisting. Newcomer Teresa Fenchurch gets off to a bad start, but her mishap brings a dashing RAF officer to the village. Francesca Annis and Samantha Bond star, with Frances Grey, Ed Stoppard, Claire Rushbrook and Leanne Best

programme.title: After the Flood
programme.desc: As Waterside prepares for another flood, Jo finally gets the answers shes been looking for but the truth changes everything

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: Fi Lawson arrives home to find strangers moving into her house, but she insists that the property isnt for sale. With events spiralling beyond her control, her panic rises as she is unable to contact her estranged husband Bram or locate her missing children. Simon Ashdowns adaptation of Louise Candlishs thriller, starring Tuppence Middleton and Martin Compston

programme.title: Weekend at Bernies
programme.desc: Two aspiring accountants are invited to their playboy bosss beach house, only to discover he has been murdered - setting the scene for all manner of comic complications as they try to convince everyone he is still alive. Slapstick comedy, starring Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart, Don Calfa and Terry Kiser

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A firefighter falls from the bell tower of the Ballarat fire station. While it initially looks like a suicide, Blake suspects foul play but he cannot find the evidence to prove it

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: The Virgin Media news team of Gavan Reilly, Zara King and Richard Chambers discuss breaking news

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Rowland Rivron puts on a dinner party at his home as he plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes look at one of the UKs busiest transport hubs, chronicling the issues that face station staff, transport workers, emergency services, commuters and tourists

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine Show
programme.desc: All the latest from the world of the UEFA Champions League, featuring highlights and interviews

programme.title: Britains Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as the first eight acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance at a place in the final. For the first time in the history of the show, the golden buzzer now appears in the live rounds, giving judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, the power to send one act straight through to the grand final. The audience will then vote for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The Mike Tomlin Show
programme.desc: Exclusive weekly sit-down with the Pittsburgh Steelers head coach, featuring insider insights, game previews, and candid commentary

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Suzy, Ed, Gemma and Arun battle to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie heads to Yeovil, where Ades hoard of historical heirlooms is proving problematic. Plus, the presenter helps a hoarder who cannot face the idea of sorting through the belongings of his late mother and brother following their tragic deaths

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former snooker player Willie Thorne is todays VIP cook, providing a selection of dishes for four guests who have to guess his identity. If the diners are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family themed edition of the game show. The Grimbleby family from Grimsby, Lincolnshire, pit their general-knowledge know-how against that of a professional quizzer

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Roofer Matti, retail assistant Max and bartender Alfie picks outfits for telecoms worker Georgia, who choose her date based entirely on their fashion choices

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host the grand final as the three remaining designers go head-to-head in their biggest challenge yet by creating their own full collections and showcasing their designs in a star-studded catwalk event. They need to impress not only MandS lead designers in this finale, but three fashion experts David Gandy, Jodie Kidd and Marco Capaldo, before one is crowned champion and wins a life-changing chance to work alongside MandS

programme.title: Hells Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs are challenged with starting individual dishes before leaving one by one and verbally aiding their teammates to finish them

programme.title: Tell Me Everything
programme.desc: Bex quickly realises the price of popularity when a new best friend talks her into hosting a huge party, and Jonny throws himself into a kickboxing tournament

programme.title: Gogglebox Ireland
programme.desc: Deirdre OKane provides the voiceover as a selection of telly addicts comment on the weeks programmes from the comfort of their living rooms

programme.title: Autopsy USA
programme.desc: Forensic pathologists investigate the cases of celebrities who died unexpectedly. This episode focuses on American actress, comedian, writer and singer Gilda Radner, wife of Gene Wilder

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
